title: The Walking Dead star Ryan Hurst revealed he was hospitalized for heat exhaustion
text:
With The Walking Dead continuing its 10th Season with the third episode this Sunday on AMC, one of the show's stars revealed he was hospitalized on set.

Ryan Hurst, who portrays Beta, the second in command of The Whisperers behind Alpha (Samantha Morton), revealed in a new interview with Entertainment Weekly that he was hospitalized this season.

The 43 year old actor, who previously starred in FX's Sons of Anarchy, said his bulky Beta costume lead to a bout of heat exhaustion.

Costume: The 43 year old actor, who previously starred in FX's Sons of Anarchy, said his bulky Beta costume lead to a bout of heat exhaustion

During his wide-ranging interview, Hurst was asked if he gets hot in the Beta costume, when he revealed he was hospitalized.

'Oh my God. I landed in the hospital once this year from heat exhaustion,' Hurst said

'I’m in a leather trench coat and two layers under that in Georgia in the summer. It’s no joke, man,' he added.

Hospitalized: During his wide-ranging interview, Hurst was asked if he gets hot in the Beta costume, when he revealed he was hospitalized

He didn't reveal how long he was hospitalized for, or how serious his bout of heat exhaustion was.

The show typically films during the sweltering summer months in and around Atlanta, Georgia, and with the costume Hurst wears as Beta, it's not terribly surprising he suffered a bout of heat exhaustion.

His character's face has not yet been seen, hiding either behind a zombie mask or a full ski mask, though it's not known which he was wearing when he was hospitalized.

Heat exhaustion: He didn't reveal how long he was hospitalized for, or how serious his bout of heat exhaustion was

The Walking Dead showrunner Angela Yang teased that Beta's face will be shown at some point, with Hurst joking about what fans will see when that happens.

'A bleary resemblance to Whoopi Goldberg,' Hurst said with a laugh. 'No, I can’t tell you too much about that.'

'We’ve been dropping Easter eggs here and there, maybe on this show, maybe on another show that’s connected to it, but I’ll sort of keep dangling that carrot and let people wait for the end of this season to see what happens.

Beta's face: The Walking Dead showrunner Angela Yang teased that Beta's face will be shown at some point, with Hurst joking about what fans will see when that happens

This season has featured a few brief flashbacks that tease Beta's past, with Hurst adding one of the most fun aspects of the character is his 'secretive nature.'

'It’s something that I very early on brought to [showrunner Angela Kang], that I had this idea of his backstory and also, how they met, and we collaborated a bunch on making this back story a reality,' he said.

'So, I’m just super happy with the way that it all worked out because Angela and I’ve been talking about this since the beginning of season 9, when I first signed on,' Hurst added.
